name: Headley Heath to White Hill Walking Trail, Box Hill

ai.summary: A challenging 16.2 km hike from Headley Heath to White Hill through the Box Hill area, combining open chalk downland, heathland and wooded sections. Expect long ascents, exposed ridges, and uneven footing. Suitable for experienced hikers with solid navigation and fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily chalk downland and heath with a mix of woodland, exposed ridges and rolling hills. Steep ascents and descents, uneven grassy and rocky paths, possible mud after rain, and sections with loose footing near White Hill. Expect panoramic views on high open stretches.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable UK weather; wind and rain can form quickly on exposed ridges. Bring a map and compass (GPS is helpful but not a substitute for navigation). Maintain hydration and regular snacks; wear sturdy footwear. Take care on steep or loose sections, especially after rain. Mobile signal may be unreliable in parts of Box Hill; carry a whistle and know emergency numbers. Start early in winter daylight; leave no trace and carry out litter.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Water (at least 2–3 liters) and high-energy snacks
Lightweight emergency shelter or foil blanket

seo.title: Headley Heath to White Hill Walking Trail – 16.2 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle a 16.2 km hard hike from Headley Heath to White Hill through the Box Hill area. Learn about terrain, safety tips and gear to prepare for this challenging UK trail.
